poem:
Title: "Tides of Fortune"

Japan's sun dips low, no more
the lender's negative shore.
Unilever, absentee of mirth,
throws 7,500 to the earth.

Yet Europe stands on brighter brink,
economies that shall not sink:
A resurrection's promised dawn,
a pulse once frail, now steadfast, strong.

In the matrix of time's dance,
Prosperity is but chance.
